results.title: The Emperor and the assassin
results.creator_credit: Chen Kaige, Satoru Iseki, Shirley Kao, Beijing Film Studio and New Wave Entertainmnet
results.brief_description: The most expensive film produced in China at its date of production, this historical epic is based on the event of the forced unification of China in the third century. By 221 BC, after centuries of civil war, seven kingdoms were dominant in China. At this time the ruler of the kingdom of Qin, Ying Zheng (Li Xuejian), raised to believe he had an ancestral duty to unify all of China, undertook a brutal conquest to achieve his goal, thus becoming the country’s first emperor. In this interpretation Zheng is aided in his quest by his lover, Lady Zhao (Gong Li), who devises a fake assassination plot to justify an invasion of the neighboring kingdom of Yan, enlisting the help of Yan assassin Jing Ke (Zhang Fengyi) who is trying to give up his bloody past. As the King becomes increasingly ruthless and bloodthirsty, Lady Zhao shifts her political and romantic allegiances to the assassin. Filled with the back-stabbing imperial politics, murderous betrayals, acts of cruelty and bloody mass slaughter usually associated with Shakespearean tragedy, the emotional impact and tension of the complex narrative is at times dwarfed by the elaborately staged, large-scale battle sequences and the visual grandeur of the landscape. Written by Chen Kaige and Wang Peigong. Photography, Zhao Fei, music, Zhao Jiping.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Chen Kaige, Satoru Iseki, Shirley Kao, Beijing Film Studio and New Wave Entertainmnet

results.title: The Emperor's new groove
results.creator_credit: Mark Dindal, Randy Fullmer and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: Emperor Kuzco is an arrogant and selfish leader and his latest plan involves destroying a hill top village to build a summer palace. He invites village elder Pancha in to discuss options, but only to find out the best place to get the sun. When the amnesiac emperor awakes to find himself turned into a llama, he blames the kindly Pancho, unaware that his conniving advisor, the wizened Yzma, and brawny brainless sidekick Kronk, have usurped his power. Demanding he be returned to the palace, Kuzco pushes Pancha’s faith that to the limit that all human beings possess goodness. Featuring the voices of David Spade, John Goodman, Eartha Kitt, Patrick Warburton, Wendie Malick and music by Tom Jones and Sting, this witty Disney animation espouses the virtues of friendship and kindness to others.

group_works.title: The Emergency situation in Africa. Valley of hope
group_works.creator_credit: David Bowen-Jones, Channel 0-28, London Film Productions, UNICEF and BBC

results.title: The Emergency situation in Africa. Valley of hope
results.creator_credit: David Bowen-Jones, Channel 0-28, London Film Productions, UNICEF and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Global report”.
This compilation tape consists of two programs. 1. “Emergency situation in Africa” illustrates the related problems of farming, malnutrition, disease and rural-urban migration in Africa. (22 mins.) 2. “Valley of hope” shows some of the benefits of having a health care worker in a developing country by comparing infant survival in two villages in Colombia; one which has a health care worker and one which doesn’t (30 mins.) “Valley of hope” is also available as an individual title.

results.title: The Echinoderms
results.creator_credit: Dennis Sawyer and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Intertidal Life of the North American Pacific Coast”.
A few species of the phylum Echinodermata found in the rich environment of the North American Pacific coast are shows. Four of the five classes are found in the inter-tidal region: Asteroidea, sea-stars; Ophiuroidea, brittle stars; Holothuriodea, sea cucumbers; and Echinoidea, sea-urchins. Uses micro-photogpraphy.

results.title: Jelly-like, worm-like and colonial invertebrates
results.creator_credit: Dennis Sawyer and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “The Intertidal Life of the North American Pacific Coast”.
This film covers various invertebrates living on the shores of British Columbia. Included are jellyfish, anemones, worms and the colonial bryozoans.

results.title: The Molluscs
results.creator_credit: Dennis Sawyer and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Intertidal Life of the North American Pacific Coast”.
The marine fauna of the British Columbian coast is extremely diverse. The more common animals of the phylum molluscs from the classes Amphineura, Gastropoda, Pelecypoda, Cephalopoda are illustrated. Shows their size, habitat and feeding habits. Industrialisation and pollution have led to the destruction of many molluscs.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dennis Sawyer and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: The Elephant man [DVD]
results.creator_credit: David Lynch, Jonathan Sanger and Brooksfilms
results.brief_description: Deformed at birth by a rare disease, penniless John Merrick is forced to become the star attraction in a travelling freak-show. Treves, a compassionate surgeon, rescues him from the fairground taunts, coaxing out of the terrified, disabled man a touchingly unembittered personality. This multi-award winning film stars Anthony Hopkins, John Hurt, John Gielgud and Anne Bancroft. Based on “The Elephant man and other reminiscences” by Sir Frederick Treves and in part on “The Elephant man: a study in human dignity” by Ashley Montagu. Cast includes John Hurt, Anthony Hopkins, Anne Bancroft, John Gielgud, Wendy Hiller

results.title: The Duellists [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Ridley Scott, David Puttnam and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: In the early nineteenth century two officers in Napoleon’s army challenge each other to a duel. Their initial skirmish, which begins over a trivial insult, becomes a fierce and obsessive passion which dominates the lives of the men over thirty years. This beautifully photographed film is a penetrating study of the lunacy of war and the decay of the aristocratic class in Europe. The first feature by Ridley Scott, its ravishing imagery recalls the classicism of pictorial art of the period: the characters are framed in backgrounds that suggest Constable and Watteau. As the two men’s bitter feud enters its second decade, the images owe much to Turner and Delacroix. The rigid codes of pre-Napoleanic France are swept away by the romantic tide of revolution. With Harvey Keitel, Keith Carradine, Albert Finney and Tom Conti. Winner of Best Debut Film, Cannes, 1977. Based on Joseph Conrad’s short story. Also available on VHS [304321]
